definition: to incite/to stir up/to instigate
to raise/to dig up/to poke/to prick/to incite/to stir up
to carry on a shoulder pole/to choose/to pick/to nitpick
to suck/to incite

sentences.english: But the chief priests and elders persuaded the multitude that they should ask Barabbas, and destroy Jesus.
sentences.chinese: 祭司长和长老，挑唆众人，求释放巴拉巴，除灭耶稣。

sentences.english: The handsome, let sensitive persuaded susceptibility show show stand at his side.
sentences.chinese: 俊河挑唆敏秀，让敏秀站在他这边。

sentences.english: But the chief priests moved the people, that he should rather release Barabbas unto them.
sentences.chinese: 只是祭司长挑唆众人，宁可释放巴拉巴给他们。

sentences.english: He was edged on by a couple of bystanders.
sentences.chinese: 他受了几个旁观者的挑唆。

sentences.english: But the chief priests and the elders persuaded the crowd to ask for Barabbas and to have Jesus executed.
sentences.chinese: 祭司长和长老挑唆众人，求释放巴拉巴，除灭耶稣。

definition: to incite disharmony/to instigate
to provoke
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
to urge sb on
to provoke/to stir up (trouble)/to instigate
to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
to entrap/to set up/to frame (up)/to make false charges against
to drive a wedge between (allies, partners etc)
to incite a quarrel (idiom); to sow discord between people/to tell tales/to make mischief
to collude with/to collaborate with/to gang up with
to kill secretly/to stab in the back
to conspire to murder/to plot against sb's life
to hinder/to obstruct/to create difficulties
to frame sb (by planting sth on them)
to instigate/to incite/to abet
to play tricks/to cause mischief
